intro: Epimedium × versicolor var. neosulphureum, commonly known as the golden flame bar sinister, is a hybrid evergreen perennial native to China. It features striking, leathery leaves that are typically a deep green with a distinctive golden or yellow margin. The plant produces delicate, upright panicles of bright yellow flowers in early spring, which are highly ornamental. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its foliage remains attractive throughout the year, offering visual interest in both summer and winter.
